title: Bug 31627 - DBCS Perspective Change Causes Core Dump After Project Addition
description:
Language: Japanese
Build driver: eclipseSDKI20030211linuxgtk
OS: RedHat8 (Japanese: locale jaJP.eucJP), gtk 2.2
JDK Ver.: IBM JDK1.3.1 + SR3
Summary: DBCS: Perspective change leads to a core dump after adding a DBCS project to the workspace.

Description:
Steps to recreate problem:
OB: Changing the perspective to CVS perspective after performing the specified sequence of actions results in a core dump.
EB: Changing the perspective should not lead to a core dump after adding a DBCS project to the workspace and performing version control operations.
SR: Create a project using DBCS characters.
Right-click the project and select 'Team' -> 'Share project...'.
Choose 'Use project name as module name' and click 'Finish'.
Navigate to the Synchronize view and select the project.
Right-click on the project and choose 'Add Version Control'.
Right-click on the project and select 'Commit'.
Right-click on the project and choose 'Delete' (select 'also delete contents under /workspace folder name').
Change the perspective to CVS perspective.
Right-click on the DBCS project and select 'Check Out As Project'.
